text:
On balance, economic welfare is improved by reducing or eliminating trade restrictions.
Note, however, that to the extent that a trade agreement increases trade restrictions
on imports from non-member countries, economic welfare gains are reduced and,
in an extreme case, could be outweighed by the costs such restrictions impose. This
could result if restrictions on trade with non-member countries increases a country's
(unrestricted) imports from a member that has higher prices than the country's previous
imports from a non-member.
